com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.sequence

Class SequenceAlignmentDocument

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.sequence.SequenceAlignmentDocument
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PluginDocument, PairedReads, XMLSerializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CombinedAlignmentAndSequenceDocument, DefaultAlignmentDocument

    public abstract class SequenceAlignmentDocument
extends Object
implements PluginDocument, PairedReads
    An alignment or contig of sequences. The only difference between an alignment or contig (see isContig()) is how they are displayed to the user. At the code level they are identical. Alignments and contigs may have a reference sequence (see getContigReferenceSequenceIndex())

    Unless the alignment is editable (see isEditable()), the only methods that need to be implemented are getNumberOfSequences() and getSequence(int).

    To construct an alignment, it is recommended you use a DefaultAlignmentDocument or to construct alignments that are too large to fit in memory, use a SequenceListOnDisk.Builder

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SequenceAlignmentDocument.ReferencedSequence
      Represents a reference to the original document that a sequence in this alignment was aligned from.

      • getNumberOfSequences

        public abstract int getNumberOfSequences()
        Number of sequences in this alignment
        Returns:
        number of sequences

      • getSequence

        public abstract SequenceDocument getSequence(int index)
        Gets one row from the alignment as a SequenceDocument. As this sequence is an alignment row, it will normally contain gaps. If implementation stores the URN of the original sequence document, see the note in getReferencedDocument(int).
        Parameters:
        index - between 0 and getNumberOfSequences()-1 inclusive.
        Returns:
        the sequence at the specified index.

      • getSequences

        public List<SequenceDocument> getSequences()
        Get the alignment as a list of sequences (Convenience function). The default implementation returns an unmodifiable list view backed by getNumberOfSequences() and getSequence(int).
        Returns:
        a list of sequences
        See Also:
        getSequencesInImmutableList()

      • getSequencesInImmutableList

        public List<SequenceDocument> getSequencesInImmutableList()
        Gets an immutable list (whose elements will not change after returning from this method). However the contents of those sequences may change unless the sequences are instances of ImmutableSequence. Despite that, this method is still useful since if sequences are deleted, added or replaced in this alignment, the returned list will not change. The default implementation of this method constructs a new list using getSequences() and returns it.
        Returns:
        an immutable list (whose elements will not change after returning from this method). However the contents of those sequences may change unless the sequences are instances of ImmutableSequence.
        Since:
        API 4.11 (Geneious 5.0)
        See Also:
        getSequences()

      • getReferencedDocument

        public AnnotatedPluginDocument getReferencedDocument(int sequenceIndexInAlignment)
        Get an original sequence document that this alignment was made from. This may be null if the alignment was not generated from sequence documents, or if the alignment has been user modified, so the reference to the original sequence document would not be relevant. Note that when an alignment implements this by storing the sequence URN and loading it on request it needs to check that the seqeunce residues has not been changed by a later edit operation. In that case the seqeunce document is no longer valid for that alignment and a null should be returned.
        Parameters:
        sequenceIndexInAlignment - the index of the sequence in the alignment to get the original document for. between 0 and getNumberOfSequences()-1 inclusive.
        Returns:
        the original document or null if this alignment does not a reference an original document for this sequence index. The default implementation of this method returns null
        See Also:
        getReferencedSequence(int)

      • getReferencedSequence

        public SequenceAlignmentDocument.ReferencedSequence getReferencedSequence(int sequenceIndexInAlignment)
        Get an original sequence document that this alignment was made from. This may be null if the alignment was not generated from sequence documents, or if the alignment has been user modified, so the reference to the original sequence document would not be relevant. Note that when an alignment implements this by storing the sequence URN and loading it on request it needs to check that the seqeunce residues has not been changed by a later edit operation. In that case the seqeunce document is no longer valid for that alignment and a null should be returned.
        Parameters:
        sequenceIndexInAlignment - the index of the sequence in the alignment to get the original document for. between 0 and getNumberOfSequences()-1 inclusive.
        Returns:
        the original document or null if this alignment does not a reference an original document for this sequence index. The default implementation of this method forwards to getReferencedDocument(int).
        See Also:
        getReferencedDocument(int)

      • getReferencedDocuments

        public final List<AnnotatedPluginDocument> getReferencedDocuments()
        Return the results of getReferencedDocument(int) for each sequence in the alignment. (Convenience function) This list will be equal length to getNumberOfSequences() with null elements for sequences with no referenced document. There may be a mixture of referenced and unreferenced documents in an alignment.
        Returns:
        the list of referenced documents

      • getReferencedSequences

        public final List<SequenceAlignmentDocument.ReferencedSequence> getReferencedSequences()
        Return the results of getReferencedSequence(int) for each sequence in the alignment. (Convenience method) This list will be equal length to getNumberOfSequences() with null elements for sequences with no referenced document. There may be a mixture of referenced and unreferenced documents in an alignment.
        Returns:
        the list of referenced documents

      • isReferencedDocumentReversed

        public boolean isReferencedDocumentReversed(int index)
        Sequence direction.
        Parameters:
        index - between 0 and getNumberOfSequences()-1 inclusive.
        Returns:
        true if getReferencedDocument(int) is not null and it is in the reverse direction of its sequence string in the alignment.

      • isEditable

        public boolean isEditable()
        true if this alignment is editable. if it is, it must implement
        reorderSequences(int[]),
        removeSequence(int) ,
        updateSequence(int, CharSequence, java.util.List, NucleotideGraph, boolean),
        and may want to implement setReferencedDocument(int, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.AnnotatedPluginDocument)

        An implementation may also want to return true from canSetAnnotations() to allow updating just the annotations via setAnnotations(int, java.util.List, boolean)
        Returns:
        true if this alignment is editable.

      • canSetAnnotations

        public boolean canSetAnnotations()
        Returns true if this alignment can have its annotations on sequences (including the consensus sequence) edited alone via setAnnotations(int, java.util.List, boolean) and setAnnotationsOnConsensus(java.util.List) Note that some alignment implementations may return true from isEditable() and allow updating their annotations via updateSequence(int, CharSequence, java.util.List, NucleotideGraph, boolean) even if they return false from this method.
        Returns:
        true if this alignment can have its annotations edited alone via setAnnotations(int, java.util.List, boolean)
        Since:
        API 4.14 (Geneious 5.1)
        See Also:
        setAnnotations(int, java.util.List, boolean), setAnnotationsOnConsensus(java.util.List), canSetAnnotationsOnConsensus()

      • reorderSequences

        public void reorderSequences(int[] ordering)
        Adjusts the ordering of sequences in the alignment according to the ordering array. If ordering[i]==j, then the sequence at index 'i' should be the sequence previously at index 'j' For example, if ordering = {0,1,3,4,2} Then: sequence at index 2 is moved to index 4 sequence at index 3 is moved to index 2 sequence at index 4 is moved to index 3 This function may only be called on alignments that return true from isEditable()
        Parameters:
        ordering - Each integer between 0 and ordering.length - 1 inclusive should occur exactly once in this array.

      • removeSequence

        public void removeSequence(int index)
        Removes the specified sequence from the alignment. All other sequences should maintain their original ordering. This function may only be called on alignments that return true from isEditable()
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the sequence to be removed. between 0 and getNumberOfSequences() - 1

      • canAddAndRemoveSequences

        public boolean canAddAndRemoveSequences()
        Check if this alignment supports adding and removing sequences.
        Returns:
        true if adding and removing sequences is supported, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        addSequence(SequenceDocument), removeSequence(int)

      • addSequence

        public void addSequence(SequenceDocument sequence)
        Add a sequence to the end of the alignment. sequence should be the gapped (aligned) sequence.
        Parameters:
        sequence - sequence to add
        See Also:
        reorderSequences(int[]), setReferencedDocument(int, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.AnnotatedPluginDocument)

      • updateSequence

        public void updateSequence(int index,
                  CharSequence sequence,
                  List<SequenceAnnotation> annotations,
                  NucleotideGraph graph,
                  boolean allowModifyingReferencedDocuments)
        Set new residues and related data for one sequence. This function may only be called on alignments that return true from isEditable() (otherwise, the method should throw UnsupportedOperationException).
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the sequence to be updated. between 0 and getNumberOfSequences() - 1
        sequence - the new residues
        annotations - a list of the annotations
        graph - Must be null if the original sequence at the specified index is not a NucleotideGraphSequenceDocument. Otherwise (i.e. if the sequence was a NucleotideGraphSequenceDocument), specifies the new graph to use for that sequence.
        allowModifyingReferencedDocuments - if the change being made to the sequence would affect the unaligned version of it (for example, the sequence residues are changing rather than just the gaps) and the alignment stores a reference an editable original SequenceDocument (which can be determined by using getReferencedDocument(int)) then if this parameter is true the original referenced sequence document will be modified. If this parameter is not true and the change would have otherwise modified the original SequenceDocument, then any reference to the original document will be discarded and a copy of the original sequence stored internally within the alignment instead.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if isEditable() is false.

      • setAnnotations

        public void setAnnotations(int index,
                  List<SequenceAnnotation> annotations,
                  boolean allowModifyingReferencedDocuments)
        Updates just the annotations on a sequence. This method may only be called if canSetAnnotations() returns true

        This is used for updating non-track annotations only. Track annotations are handled via a different API. To update or add tracks check if a sequence in the alignment implements SequenceTrack.Manager.Provider

        Parameters:
        index - the 0-based index of the sequence to set annotations on, or -1 to set annotations on the consensus sequence.
        annotations - the new annotations for this sequence, which will replace any existing annotations.
        allowModifyingReferencedDocuments - if this is true the original referenced sequence document will be modified to use these annotations If this parameter is not true and then any reference to the original document will be discarded and a copy of the original sequence stored internally within the alignment instead.
        Since:
        API 4.14 (Geneious 5.1)

      • setReferencedDocument

        public boolean setReferencedDocument(int sequenceIndexInAlignment,
                            AnnotatedPluginDocument document)
        Sets the sequence at the given sequenceIndexInAlignment in this alignment to refer to the given document as if it is the original source. This document must contain a sequence consisting of residues matching the aligned sequence stored at sequenceIndexInAlignment , with gap residues removed. This method may be used when the user chooses to extract a sequence from an alignment, so the alignment should now be updated to reference the extracted sequence. Any alignment implementations may choose to not implement this method, in which case of the default implementation is used which always returns false.
        Parameters:
        sequenceIndexInAlignment - the sequenceIndexInAlignment of the sequence referred to. between 0 and getNumberOfSequences() - 1
        document - the document to reference
        Returns:
        true if this document was successfully set as a referenced document. Note that some implementations may allow setting the reference and return true, but then discard the reference next time it is requested if the sequence from the referenced document does not correspond to sequence in the alignment. Call getReferencedDocument(int) to check if it really worked.

      • setReferencedSequence

        public boolean setReferencedSequence(int sequenceIndexInAlignment,
                            SequenceAlignmentDocument.ReferencedSequence referencedSequence,
                            int referencedDocumentRevisionNumberSequenceWasCopiedFrom)
        Sets the sequence at the given index in this alignment to refer to the given document as if it is the original source. This document must contain a sequence consisting of residues matching the aligned sequence stored at sequenceIndexInAlignment , with gap residues removed. This method may be used when the user chooses to extract a sequence from an alignment, so the alignment should now be updated to reference the extracted sequence. Any alignment implementations may choose to not implement this method, in which case of the default implementation is used which always returns false.
        Parameters:
        sequenceIndexInAlignment - the sequenceIndexInAlignment of the sequence referred to. between 0 and getNumberOfSequences() - 1
        referencedSequence - the document to reference
        referencedDocumentRevisionNumberSequenceWasCopiedFrom - normally an alignment document stores the most recent revision number it updated its local cache of the sequence from. In order to improve performance, if it is known what revision number (see AnnotatedPluginDocument.getRevisionNumber() the current alignment sequence was created from then it can be supplied here. Use -1 if unsure.
        Returns:
        true if this document was successfully set as a referenced document
        Since:
        API 4.40 (Geneious 5.4.0)

      • setReferencedSequence

        public boolean setReferencedSequence(int sequenceIndexInAlignment,
                            SequenceAlignmentDocument.ReferencedSequence referencedSequence)
        Equivalent to setReferencedSequence(sequenceIndexInAlignment, referencedSequence, -1
        Parameters:
        sequenceIndexInAlignment - the sequenceIndexInAlignment of the sequence referred to. between 0 and getNumberOfSequences() - 1
        referencedSequence - the document to reference
        Returns:
        true if this document was successfully set as a referenced document

      • asJeblAlignmentIfMemoryAllows

        public final Alignment asJeblAlignmentIfMemoryAllows(boolean silentlyStripDuplicates)
                                              throws DocumentOperationException
        This method calls #asJeblAlignment(boolean) and re-throws any OutOfMemoryError as a DocumentOperationException
        Parameters:
        silentlyStripDuplicates - Unlike Geneious alignments, Jebl alignments cannot contain sequences with the same names. If this parameter is true, duplicate sequences will be absent from the returned alignment. if this parameter is false, sequences will be given unique names by appending "1", "2", etc .
        Returns:
        sequences as a Jebl alignment
        Throws:
        DocumentOperationException - if there is not enough memory to create the Jebl alignment
        Since:
        API 4.65 (Geneious 5.6.5)
        See Also:
        asJeblAlignment(boolean)

      • asJeblAlignment

        public Alignment asJeblAlignment(boolean silentlyStripDuplicates)
        Get alignment as a Jebl alignment. Throws an OutOfMemoryError if there is not enough memory to do so.
        Parameters:
        silentlyStripDuplicates - Unlike Geneious alignments, Jebl alignments cannot contain sequences with the same names. If this parameter is true, duplicate sequences will be absent from the returned alignment. if this parameter is false, sequences will be given unique names by appending "1", "2", etc . This function is implemented for all alignments. Sub-classes need not implement it, but may wish to if they internally store their alignment in jebl format already.
        Returns:
        sequences as a Jebl alignment

      • getSequenceAsJeblSequence

        public Sequence getSequenceAsJeblSequence(int index)
        Gets a sequence as a jebl sequence
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the sequence to get. between 0 and getNumberOfSequences() - 1
        Returns:
        sequence as a jebl sequence
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - wrapping a DocumentOperationException if the referenced sequence of the alignment cannot be loaded. This function is implemented for all alignments by converting the result of getSequence(int). Sub-classes need not implement it, but may wish to if they internally store their sequences in jebl format already.

      • toHTML

        public String toHTML()
        Description copied from interface: PluginDocument
        Provide a textual view of document. The contents should be at most 30K-60K characters. One reason is that this text is rendered using JTextPane, which is horrendously slow when handling large text. The more fundamental reason is that large amounts of text are generally not useful for a user. The whole idea of using a tool such as Geneious is to provide specialized viewers which make the large amount of bioinformatics data perceivable and comprehensible to a human user.

        Return an HTML body fragment (i.e. a fragment which sits inside a <body></body> tag). (Header,stylesheet and annotations are automatically added by GENEious code).

        Can optionally return an entire html tag set, as long as the first six characters are <html>

        Specified by:
        toHTML in interface PluginDocument
        Returns:
        an HTML fragment of tag set, or null to have no text view.

      • isContig

        public boolean isContig()
        Returns false by default. If true then this alignment may should be treated as a contig (may affect e.g. the way consensus sequence are calculated).

        If this is overridden to return true by classes other than DefaultAlignmentDocument then the document will not be given the contig icon (to set non default icons for a document see DocumentType.OVERRIDE_DOCUMENT_TYPE_KEY.

        Use DefaultAlignmentDocument.setContig(boolean) to create a contig.

        Returns:
        true if this alignment should be treated as a contig
        See Also:
        DefaultAlignmentDocument.setContig(boolean)

      • canSetSequenceNames

        public boolean canSetSequenceNames()
        Specifies whether this alignment supports changing the sequence names. If this method returns true, then this alignment must implement setSequenceName(int, String, boolean)
        Returns:
        true if this alignment supports changing the sequence names.

      • setSequenceName

        public void setSequenceName(int index,
                   String newName,
                   boolean allowModifyingReferencedDocuments)
        change the name of a sequence within the alignment. This method may only be called if canSetSequenceNames() returns true.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the sequence name to change
        newName - the new name for the sequence.
        allowModifyingReferencedDocuments - if the alignment stores a reference to an editable original SequenceDocument (which can be determined by using getReferencedDocument(int)) then if this parameter is true the original referenced sequence document will be renamed too. Otherwise, any existing reference to the original SequenceDocument will be discarded and a copy of the original sequence stored internally within the alignment instead.

      • isFreeEndGapAlignment

        public boolean isFreeEndGapAlignment()
        True if this alignment was built using free end gaps. This means gaps at either end of the sequences are not penalized.
        Returns:
        true if this alignment was built using free end gaps. The default implementation returns true.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the original alignment
        Returns:
        the name for the refined alignment.
        See Also:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the name for the realigned alignment.
        See Also:

      • getContigReferenceSequenceIndex

        public int getContigReferenceSequenceIndex()
        Get the index (if any) of the reference sequence in a contig. Note - despite the name, this method can also be used to identify the query sequence in a query centric alignment.

        The default implementation returns -1.

        Returns:
        the index (in the range [0,getNumberOfSequences()-1]) or -1 to if this contig has no reference sequence.

      • isQueryCentricAlignment

        public boolean isQueryCentricAlignment()
        Returns true if this alignment is a query centric alignment. A query centric alignment must also return a non-negative number from getContigReferenceSequenceIndex().
        Returns:
        true if this alignment is a query centric alignment.

      • getMateExpectedDistance

        public int getMateExpectedDistance(int sequenceIndex)
        Description copied from interface: PairedReads
        Gets the expected mate distance (also known as predicted median insert size) of this nucleotide sequence from its mate. This is defined as the length of the 2 reads plus the distance between them. For example if the 2 reads both have length 30 with a 40 bp gap between them, then the expected mate distance is 100. If the mate is expected to appear after this sequence with this sequence in its current orientation, then the expected distance will be positive. If the mate is expected to appear before this sequence with this sequence in its current orientation, then the expected distance will be negative.
        Specified by:
        getMateExpectedDistance in interface PairedReads
        Parameters:
        sequenceIndex - the index of the nucleotide sequence for which to get the mate index of.
        Returns:
        the expected mate distance or 0 if this read is not paired. Note that a read may still have a mate distance!=0 but its mate may not be present in this document (in which case PairedReads.getMateIndex(int) will be -1.
        See Also:
        PairedReads.getMateIndex(int)

      • getMateIndex

        public int getMateIndex(int sequenceIndex)
        Description copied from interface: PairedReads
        Gets the index of the mate (if any) of the nucleotide sequence at this index.
        Specified by:
        getMateIndex in interface PairedReads
        Parameters:
        sequenceIndex - the index of the nucleotide sequence to get the mate index of
        Returns:
        an index of the mate of the sequence, or -1 if the sequence has no mate.
        See Also:
        PairedReads.getMateExpectedDistance(int)

      • getImmutablePairedReadManager

        public PairedReadManager getImmutablePairedReadManager()
        Description copied from interface: PairedReads
        An immutable view of the paired reads managed by this list or alignment. Even if the list or alignment that implements this method is later modified, the returned PairedReadManager will not change.
        Specified by:
        getImmutablePairedReadManager in interface PairedReads
        Returns:
        An immutable view of the paired reads managed by the list or alignment that implements this method or null if this class doesn't provide an immutable view of its paired reads.

      • setMates

        public void setMates(int sequenceIndex,
            int sequenceIndexOfMate,
            int expectedMateDistance)
        Records the 2nd sequence as being paired with the first sequence with the given distance.

        If the mate sequence is not yet paired with this sequence then this method also sets the expected mate's distance to be -expectedMateDistance. If the mate sequence is already paired with this sequence, then this method does not change the distance recorded for the mate. This is so that if a contig is created where the 2 mates haven been mapped in opposite directions (due to an inversion from the reference sequence), the expected distance can be correctly set for each of them since both values should be either positive or negative in this case. (see getMateExpectedDistance(int))

        Parameters:
        sequenceIndex - the sequence to set the mate for.
        sequenceIndexOfMate - the index of its mate, or -1 if its mate is not in this contig.
        expectedMateDistance - the expected mate distance. See getMateExpectedDistance(int)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this sequence already has a different mate or if its mate is paired to a different sequence.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this alignment does not support setting mates. All editable alignment implementations (see isEditable() for which getImmutablePairedReadManager().hasAnyPairedReads() returns true must not throw a UnsupportedOperationException.
        Since:
        API 4.11 (Geneious 5.0)

      • canSetAnnotationsOnConsensus

        public boolean canSetAnnotationsOnConsensus()
        Returns:
        true if this alignment implementation supports calling setAnnotationsOnConsensus(java.util.List).
        Since:
        API 4.11 (Geneious 5.0)
        See Also:
        setAnnotationsOnConsensus(java.util.List)

      • getAnnotationsOnConsensus

        public List<SequenceAnnotation> getAnnotationsOnConsensus()
        Gets annotations that are associated with the consensus sequence. Note - this doesn't include consensus annotations in tracks. Consensus tracks can be obtained by checking if this alignment implements SequenceTrack.Manager.Provider
        Returns:
        annotations that are associated with the consensus sequence. Never null but may be empty
        Since:
        API 4.11 (Geneious 5.0)

      • setAnnotationsOnConsensus

        public void setAnnotationsOnConsensus(List<SequenceAnnotation> annotations)
        Sets the annotations on the consensus sequence that will be returned from a later call to getAnnotationsOnConsensus(). It is only legal to call this method if canSetAnnotationsOnConsensus() returns true.
        Parameters:
        annotations - the annotations to store on the consensus. Must not be null. This replaces any existing annotations on the consensus.
        Since:
        API 4.11 (Geneious 5.0)
        See Also:
        getAnnotationsOnConsensus(), canSetAnnotationsOnConsensus()

      • getSequenceType

        public SequenceType getSequenceType()
        Returns the sequence type of the first sequence in this alignment (which should be the same as all other sequences in the alignment)
        Returns:
        the sequence type of the first sequence in this alignment (which should be the same as all other sequences in the alignment)
        Since:
        API 4.40 (Geneious 5.4.0)

      • getCircularLength

        public int getCircularLength()
        If this alignment is circular, returns the gapped length at which it wraps back to the start or 0 if this alignment is not circular. For example, if an alignment looks like

        RefSeq: -GATTACA----
        Read 1: ----TACAAGA-
        Read 2: -----ACA-GAT

        this could have a circular length of 8 to indicate the reads extending past the last base of the refSeq and considered to wrap back to the start.
        Returns:
        if this alignment is circular, returns the gapped length at which it wraps back to the start or 0 if this alignment is not circular
        Since:
        API 4.50 (Geneious 5.5.0)

      • canSetFieldValue

        public boolean canSetFieldValue(int sequenceIndex,
                       DocumentField field)
        Returns true if this alignment supports updating field values using setFieldValue(int, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.DocumentField, Object, boolean)
        Parameters:
        sequenceIndex - the index of a sequence in the alignment
        field - the field to update
        Returns:
        true if this alignment supports updating field values using setFieldValue(int, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.DocumentField, Object, boolean)
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)
        See Also:
        setFieldValue(int, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.DocumentField, Object, boolean)

      • setFieldValue

        public void setFieldValue(int sequenceIndex,
                 DocumentField field,
                 Object fieldValue,
                 boolean allowModifyingOriginals)
        Sets the value of a displayable field on one of the sequences in the alignment. This method may only be called if canSetFieldValue(int, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.DocumentField) returns true.
        Parameters:
        sequenceIndex - the index of a sequence in the alignment to update the field value on
        field - the field to update
        fieldValue - the new value for the field.
        allowModifyingOriginals - true if this field change may be propagated to a referenced sequence (if any). If this is false the sequence will be disconnected from its referenced document.
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)
        See Also:
        canSetFieldValue(int, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.DocumentField)
